name: Batcave
description: Secret headquarters and command center for Batman located beneath Wayne Manor.

content.title: History
content.body: The Batcave serves as the secret lair and command center for Batman. It is situated beneath Wayne Manor and has been used by Bruce Wayne since he adopted the vigilante persona of Batman. The Batcave has evolved over time, housing numerous technological innovations and tools necessary for Batman's operations.

content.title: Geography
content.body: Located beneath Wayne Manor, the Batcave is a sprawling subterranean complex. It takes advantage of natural caverns and tunnels, which have been expanded upon over the years. Its exact location within Gotham City is kept secret, accessible only to a few trusted individuals.

content.title: Notable Features
content.body:
The Batcave houses many significant facilities and equipment, including:
- **Batcomputer:** A powerful computer system used for research and surveillance.
- **Armory and Workshop:** Contains the Batsuit, Batpod, and other gadgets.
- **Trophy Room:** Displays various artifacts from Batman's past missions.
- **Training Area:** Equipped for physical training and combat simulation.
- **Hangar:** Houses the Batmobile and other vehicles.

content.title: Story Significance
content.body: Throughout *The Dark Knight Trilogy*, the Batcave serves as Batman's base of operations. Key scenes include his strategic planning against villains such as the Joker and Bane. It is a symbol of Batman's dual life and his commitment to protecting Gotham City.
